| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2488](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2488 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **deep gnome**, G, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). The deep gnome is an always-male monster that is part of the [gnome](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_class\) "Gnome (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") - they will seek out [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems") to collect among other items, and can [tunnel](/wiki/Tunnel "Tunnel") through walls with the aid of a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"). In SLASH'EM, deep gnomes are not considered [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(monster_attribute\) "Gnome (monster attribute)"), despite being nearly identical to [gnome kings](/wiki/Gnome_king "Gnome king") - in SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, they are properly considered gnomish monsters. Deep gnomes share a glyph with the [gnoll](/wiki/Gnoll_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Gnoll (SLASH'EM)"), G.

A deep gnome has a single weapon attack, and [hits as a +1 weapon](/wiki/Hits_creatures_as_%2Bx_weapon "Hits creatures as +x weapon").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [4 References](#References)

## Generation

Deep gnomes may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters, [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") characters and [dwarven](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)") characters. They are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), though they can also appear on other levels that generate G at level creation if the difficulty is appropriate.

Deep gnomes have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with one of the seven default weapon sets, with an equal probability for each: 3-14 [darts](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), a [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow") and 3-14 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt"), a [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow") and 3-14 [arrows](/wiki/Arrow "Arrow"), a stack of 3-5 [daggers](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys"), a [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), or a [club](/wiki/Club "Club").[\[1\]](#cite_note-default-1)

Deep gnomes are eligible for [offensive items](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item"), [defensive items](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item"), and [miscellaneous items](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item").

## Strategy

Characters should keep on guard and [far look](/wiki/Far_look "Far look") any G they encounter - it can be dangerous to confuse a deep gnome with a gnoll.

## Encyclopedia entry

Far beneath the surface of the earth dwell the Svirfneblin, or Deep  
Gnomes. Small parties of these demihumans roam the Underdark's mazes  
of small passageways searching for gemstones. They are said to dwell  
in great cities consisting of a closely connected series of tunnels,  
buildings, and caverns in which up to a thousand of these diminutive  
creatures live. They keep the location of these hidden cities secret  
in order to protect them from their deadly foes, the kuo-toa, Drow,  
and mind flayers.  
Svirfneblin are slightly smaller than rock gnomes, but their thin,  
wiry, gnarled frames are just as strong. Their skin is rock-colored,  
usually medium brown to brownish gray, and their eyes are gray. Male  
svirfneblin are completely bald; female deep gnomes have stringy gray  
hair. The average svirfneblin life span is 250 years.

\[ The Underdark, by Mike Drees and Albert Foster ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-default_1-0) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 166](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line166 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c"): *Default set of cases for monster weapon generation in SLASH'EM*

Deep gnome

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
G deep gnome
Difficulty 6
Attacks Weapon 2d6
G deep gnome
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Weapon 2d6

Base level 5
Base experience 61
Speed 10
Base AC 10
Base MR 20
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 750
Nutritional value 150
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A deep gnome:

  • can tunnel through walls.
  • needs a pick-axe to tunnel through walls.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is male.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • hits creatures as a +1 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2488

A deep gnome, G, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. The deep gnome is an always-male monster that is part of the gnome monster class - they will seek out gold and gems to collect among other items, and can tunnel through walls with the aid of a pick-axe or dwarvish mattock. In SLASH'EM, deep gnomes are not considered gnomish, despite being nearly identical to gnome kings - in SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, they are properly considered gnomish monsters. Deep gnomes share a glyph with the gnoll, G.

A deep gnome has a single weapon attack, and hits as a +1 weapon.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Encyclopedia entry
  • 4 References

Generation

Deep gnomes may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters, gnomish characters and dwarven characters. They are only randomly generated in Gehennom, though they can also appear on other levels that generate G at level creation if the difficulty is appropriate.

Deep gnomes have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with one of the seven default weapon sets, with an equal probability for each: 3-14 darts, a crossbow and 3-14 crossbow bolts, a bow and 3-14 arrows, a stack of 3-5 daggers, an aklys, a short sword, or a club.[1]

Deep gnomes are eligible for offensive items, defensive items, and miscellaneous items.

Strategy

Characters should keep on guard and far look any G they encounter - it can be dangerous to confuse a deep gnome with a gnoll.

Encyclopedia entry

Far beneath the surface of the earth dwell the Svirfneblin, or Deep
Gnomes. Small parties of these demihumans roam the Underdark's mazes
of small passageways searching for gemstones. They are said to dwell
in great cities consisting of a closely connected series of tunnels,
buildings, and caverns in which up to a thousand of these diminutive
creatures live. They keep the location of these hidden cities secret
in order to protect them from their deadly foes, the kuo-toa, Drow,
and mind flayers.
Svirfneblin are slightly smaller than rock gnomes, but their thin,
wiry, gnarled frames are just as strong. Their skin is rock-colored,
usually medium brown to brownish gray, and their eyes are gray. Male
svirfneblin are completely bald; female deep gnomes have stringy gray
hair. The average svirfneblin life span is 250 years.

[ The Underdark, by Mike Drees and Albert Foster ]

References

  1. ↑ makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 166: Default set of cases for monster weapon generation in SLASH'EM

A '''deep gnome''', {{monsym|deep gnome}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. The deep gnome is an always-male monster that is part of the [[Gnome (monster class)|gnome]] [[monster class]] - they will seek out [[gold]] and [[gems]] to collect among other items, and can [[tunnel]] through walls with the aid of a [[pick-axe]] or [[dwarvish mattock]]. In SLASH'EM, deep gnomes are not considered [[Gnome (monster attribute)|gnomish]], despite being nearly identical to [[gnome king]]s - in SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, they are properly considered gnomish monsters. Deep gnomes share a glyph with the [[Gnoll (SLASH'EM)|gnoll]], {{monsym|gnoll}}.

A deep gnome has a single weapon attack, and [[Hits creatures as +x weapon|hits as a +1 weapon]].

==Generation==
Deep gnomes may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters, [[Gnome (starting race)|gnomish]] characters and [[Dwarf (starting race)|dwarven]] characters. They are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], though they can also appear on other levels that generate {{white|G}} at level creation if the difficulty is appropriate.

Deep gnomes have a {{frac|2}} chance of being generated with one of the seven default weapon sets, with an equal probability for each: 3-14 [[dart]]s, a [[crossbow]] and 3-14 [[crossbow bolt]]s, a [[bow]] and 3-14 [[arrow]]s, a stack of 3-5 [[dagger]]s, an [[aklys]], a [[short sword]], or a [[club]].{{refsrc|makemon.c|166|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2|name="default"|comment=Default set of cases for monster weapon generation in SLASH'EM}}

Deep gnomes are eligible for [[offensive item]]s, [[defensive item]]s, and [[miscellaneous item]]s.

==Strategy==
Characters should keep on guard and [[far look]] any {{gray|G}} they encounter - it can be dangerous to confuse a deep gnome with a gnoll.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
Far beneath the surface of the earth dwell the Svirfneblin, or Deep
Gnomes. Small parties of these demihumans roam the Underdark's mazes
of small passageways searching for gemstones. They are said to dwell
in great cities consisting of a closely connected series of tunnels,
buildings, and caverns in which up to a thousand of these diminutive
creatures live. They keep the location of these hidden cities secret
in order to protect them from their deadly foes, the kuo-toa, Drow,
and mind flayers.
Svirfneblin are slightly smaller than rock gnomes, but their thin,
wiry, gnarled frames are just as strong. Their skin is rock-colored,
usually medium brown to brownish gray, and their eyes are gray. Male
svirfneblin are completely bald; female deep gnomes have stringy gray
hair. The average svirfneblin life span is 250 years.
|		[ The Underdark, by Mike Drees and Albert Foster ]}}
